Thank you parents for your responses!

We have secured a majority of your responses, choosing remote or face-to-face. At this point in time we are confident we can provide opportunities to all our students in either the face-to-face or remote learning environment safely and effectively. Our staff has been working incredibly hard and we will be prepared to open on August 31st. Your continued patience has been appreciated. Please know we do not have intention to change our delivery of instruction unless unforeseen conditions result in transition to full remote learning due to Covid19 contact tracing. Social distancing, masks, cleaning and many other protocols are being taken.

We appreciate you all and felt the need to send this announcement as a sincere thank you to all for your ongoing support and cooperation during our extensive planning process! We are very proud of our community and would not be where we are today without you!

post_text: The Campbell City School District Board of Education welcomes Michael J. Balale, Sr. as the new Head Soccer Coach effective for the 2020-2021 school year. Mr. Balale graduated from Campbell Memorial High School in 1998. While a student, he was named to the Tri-County All Star Team in soccer. Coach Balale has over 15 years experience as both a player and coach. He currently serves as a Trustee for Poland Soccer and is also a youth coach for Poland traveling soccer. Coach Balale owns a clothing and apparel business based in Poland and is also a Wealth Management advisor at a financial institution. "I can't begin to say how excited and honored I am to be named the varsity head coach at Campbell Memorial! The drive, grit and passion this city has doesn't leave you, it shapes you. We will compete relentlessly on the field and work harder than every opponent we face, " said Coach Balale.

Students in Mr. Allen's Physical Science Class recently go to make ice cream. The students have been exploring solutions, solutes, and solvents in class. Part of this topic was freezing point depression, how the addition of a solute to a solvent (in this case salt being added to the ice) lowers the freezing point of the solvent.

In order to better understand this phenomenon and see it in action, they made ice cream in bags. Lots of heat has to be removed for the water in cream to solidify. Because of all the particles it contains, the temperature must drop below zero degrees Celsius. In order for this to occur we need the heat to go somewhere else.
